th.name: abbr
th.description: Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a header cell

text.description: A short description of the header cell content

input.name: accept
input.description: Specifies a filter for what file types the user can pick from the file input dialog box (only for type="file")

file_extension.name: file_extension
file_extension.description: Specify the file extension(s) (e.g:.gif,.jpg,.png,.doc) the user can pick from

audio/*.name: audio/*
audio/*.description: The user can pick all sound files

video/*.name: video/*
video/*.description: The user can pick all video files

image/*.name: image/*
image/*.description: The user can pick all image files

media_type.name: media_type
media_type.description: A valid media type, with no parameters. Look at IANA Media Types for a complete list of standard media types

form.name: accept-charset
form.description: Specifies the character encodings that are to be used for the form submission

character-set.description: A space-separated list of one or more character encodings that are to be used for the form submission. Common values: UTF-8 - Character encoding for Unicode ISO-8859-1 - Character encoding for the Latin alphabet In theory, any character encoding can be used, but no browser understands all of them. The more widely a character encoding is used, the better the chance that a browser will understand it. To view all available character encodings, go to our Character sets reference.

global.name: accesskey
global.description: Specifies a shortcut key to activate/focus an element

text.description: A single character that specifies the shortcut key to activate/focus the element

form.name: action
form.description: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted

u-r-l.description: Where to send the form-data when the form is submitted. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like action="http://www.example.com/example.htm") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like action="example.htm")

iframe.name: allow
iframe.description: Specifies a feature policy for the <iframe>

iframe.name: allowfullscreen
iframe.description: Set to true if the <iframe> can activate fullscreen mode by calling the requestFullscreen() method

iframe.name: allowpaymentrequest
iframe.description: Set to true if a cross-origin <iframe> should be allowed to invoke the Payment Request API

area.name: alt
area.description: Specifies an alternate text for the area. Required if the href attribute is present

text.description: Specifies the alternate text for the area, if the image cannot be displayed

img.name: alt
img.description: Specifies an alternate text for an image

text.description: Specifies an alternate text for an image. Guidelines for the alt text: The text should describe the image if the image contains information The text should explain where the link goes if the image is inside an <a> element Use alt="" if the image is only for decoration

input.name: alt
input.description: Specifies an alternate text for images (only for type="image")

text.description: Specifies an alternate text for the image

script.name: async
script.description: Specifies that the script is downloaded in parallel to parsing the page, and executed as soon as it is available (before parsing completes) (only for external scripts)

form.name: autocomplete
form.description: Specifies whether a form should have autocomplete on or off

on-off.description:
on: Default. The browser will automatically complete values based on values that the user has entered before

off: The user must enter a value into each field for every use. The browser does not automatically complete entries

input.name: autocomplete
input.description: Specifies whether an <input> element should have autocomplete enabled

caveats: Tip: In some browsers you may need to activate an autocomplete function for this to work (Look under "Preferences" in the browser's menu).

on-off.description:
off: Specifies that autocomplete is off (disabled)

on: Default. Specifies that autocomplete is on (enabled)

button.name: autofocus
button.description: Specifies that a button should automatically get focus when the page loads

input.name: autofocus
input.description: Specifies that an <input> element should automatically get focus when the page loads

select.name: autofocus
select.description: Specifies that the drop-down list should automatically get focus when the page loads

textarea.name: autofocus
textarea.description: Specifies that a text area should automatically get focus when the page loads

audio.name: autoplay
audio.description: Specifies that the audio will start playing as soon as it is ready

video.name: autoplay
video.description: Specifies that the video will start playing as soon as it is ready

meta.name: charset
meta.description: Specifies the character encoding for the HTML document

character-set.description: Specifies the character encoding for the HTML document. The HTML5 specification encourages web developers to use the UTF-8 character set!

input.name: checked
input.description: Specifies that an <input> element should be pre-selected when the page loads (for type="checkbox" or type="radio")

blockquote.name: cite
blockquote.description: Specifies the source of the quotation

caveats: The cite attribute does not render as anything special in any of the major browsers, but it can be used by search engines to get more information about the quotation.

u-r-l.description: The source of the quotation. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like cite="http://www.example.com/page.htm") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like cite="page.htm")

del.name: cite
del.description: Specifies a URL to a document that explains the reason why the text was deleted/changed

caveats: Note: The cite attribute has no visual effect in ordinary web browsers, but can be used by screen readers.

u-r-l.description: Specifies the address to the document that explains why the text was deleted. Possible values: An absolute URL - Points to another web site (like cite="http://www.example.com/page.htm") A relative URL - Points to a page within a web site (like cite="page.htm")

ins.name: cite
ins.description: Specifies a URL to a document that explains the reason why the text was inserted/changed

caveats: Note: The cite attribute has no visual effect in ordinary web browsers, but can be used by screen readers.

u-r-l.description: Specifies the address to the document that explains why the text was inserted/changed. Possible values: An absolute URL - Points to another web site (like cite="http://www.example.com") A relative URL - Points to a page within a web site (like cite="example.html")

q.name: cite
q.description: Specifies the source URL of the quote

caveats: Note: The cite attribute has no visual effect in ordinary web browsers, but can be used by screen readers.

u-r-l.description: Specifies the source URL of the quote. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like href="http://www.example.com/page.htm") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like href="page.htm")

global.name: class
global.description: Specifies one or more classnames for an element (refers to a class in a style sheet)

text.description: Specifies one or more class names for an element. To specify multiple classes, separate the class names with a space, e.g.<span class="left important">. This allows you to combine several CSS classes for one HTML element. Naming rules: Must begin with a letter A-Z or a-z Can be followed by: letters (A-Za-z), digits (0-9), hyphens ("-"), and underscores ("_")

textarea.name: cols
textarea.description: Specifies the visible width of a text area

number.description: Specifies the width of the text area (in average character width). Default value is 20

td.name: colspan
td.description: Specifies the number of columns a cell should span

caveats: Note: Only Firefox supports colspan="0", which has a special meaning (look below in the "Attribute Values" table).

number.description: Specifies the number of columns a cell should span. Note: colspan="0" tells the browser to span the cell to the last column of the column group (colgroup)

th.name: colspan
th.description: Specifies the number of columns a header cell should span

caveats: Note: Only Firefox supports colspan="0", which has a special meaning (look below in the "Attribute Values" table).

number.description: Sets the number of columns a header cell should span. Note: colspan="0" tells the browser to span the cell to the last column of the column group (colgroup)

meta.name: content
meta.description: Specifies the value associated with the http-equiv or name attribute

text.description: The content of the meta information

global.name: contenteditable
global.description: Specifies whether the content of an element is editable or not

true.name: true
true.description: Specifies that the element is editable

false.name: false
false.description: Specifies that the element is not editable

audio.name: controls
audio.description: Specifies that audio controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button etc)

video.name: controls
video.description: Specifies that video controls should be displayed (such as a play/pause button etc).

area.name: coords
area.description: Specifies the coordinates of the area

x1,y1,x2,y2.name: x1,y1,x2,y2
x1,y1,x2,y2.description: Specifies the coordinates of the top-left and bottom-right corner of the rectangle (shape="rect")

x,y,radius.name: x,y,radius
x,y,radius.description: Specifies the coordinates of the circle center and the radius (shape="circle")

x1,y1,x2,y2,..,xn,yn.name: x1,y1,x2,y2,..,xn,yn
x1,y1,x2,y2,..,xn,yn.description: Specifies the coordinates of the edges of the polygon. If the first and last coordinate pairs are not the same, the browser will add the last coordinate pair to close the polygon (shape="poly")

img.name: crossorigin
img.description: Allow images from third-party sites that allow cross-origin access to be used with canvas

link.name: crossorigin
link.description: Specifies how the element handles cross-origin requests

script.name: crossorigin
script.description: Sets the mode of the request to an HTTP CORS Request

anonymoususe-credentials.name: anonymoususe-credentials
anonymoususe-credentials.description: Specifies the mode of the CORS request: anonymous - A cross-origin request is performed. No credentials are sent use-credentials - A cross-origin request is performed. Credentials are sent (e.g.a cookie, a certificate, a HTTP Basic authentication)

object.name: data
object.description: Specifies the URL of the resource to be used by the object

u-r-l.description: Specifies the URL of the resource to be used by the object. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to data on another web site (like href="http://www.example.com/images/pic_trulli.jpg") A relative URL - points to data within a web site (like href="pic_trulli.jpg")

global.name: data-*
global.description: Used to store custom data private to the page or application

somevalue.name: somevalue
somevalue.description: Specifies the value of the attribute (as a string)

del.name: datetime
del.description: Specifies the date and time of when the text was deleted/changed

caveats: Note: The datetime attribute has no visual effect in ordinary web browsers, but can be used by screen readers.

date-time.description: The date and time of when the text was deleted. Explanation of components: YYYY - year (e.g.2012) MM - month (e.g.01 for January) DD - day of the month (e.g.08) T or a space - a separator (required if time is also specified) hh - hour (e.g.22 for 10.00pm) mm - minutes (e.g.55) ss - seconds (e.g.03) TZD - Time Zone Designator (Z denotes Zulu, also known as Greenwich Mean Time)

ins.name: datetime
ins.description: Specifies the date and time when the text was inserted/changed

caveats: Note: The datetime attribute has no visual effect in ordinary web browsers, but can be used by screen readers.

date-time.description: Specifies the date and time of when the text was inserted/changed. Explanation of components: YYYY - year (e.g.2009) MM - month (e.g.01 for January) DD - day of the month (e.g.08) T or a space - a separator (required if time is also specified) hh - hour (e.g.22 for 10.00pm) mm - minutes (e.g.55) ss - seconds (e.g.03) TZD - Time Zone Designator (Z denotes Zulu, also known as Greenwich Mean Time)

time.name: datetime
time.description: Represent a machine-readable format of the <time> element

date-time.description: The date or time being specified. Explanation of components: YYYY - year (e.g.2011) MM - month (e.g.01 for January) DD - day of the month (e.g.08) T or a space - a separator (required if time is also specified) hh - hour (e.g.22 for 10.00pm) mm - minutes (e.g.55) ss - seconds (e.g.03) TZD - Time Zone Designator (Z denotes Zulu, also known as Greenwich Mean Time) P - a prefix for "Period" D - a prefix for "Days" H - a prefix for "Hours" M - a prefix for "Minutes" S - a prefix for "Seconds"

track.name: default
track.description: Specifies that the track is to be enabled if the user's preferences do not indicate that another track would be more appropriate

script.name: defer
script.description: Specifies that the script is downloaded in parallel to parsing the page, and executed after the page has finished parsing (only for external scripts)

global.name: dir
global.description: Specifies the text direction for the content in an element

auto.name: auto
auto.description: Let the browser figure out the text direction, based on the content (only recommended if the text direction is unknown)

input.name: dirname
input.description: Specifies that the text direction will be submitted

name.dir.name: name.dir
name.dir.description: Specifies that the text direction of the input field will be submitted.

textarea.name: dirname
textarea.description: Specifies that the text direction of the textarea will be submitted

name.dir.name: name.dir
name.dir.description: Specifies that the text direction of the textarea will be submitted.

button.name: disabled
button.description: Specifies that a button should be disabled

fieldset.name: disabled
fieldset.description: Specifies that a group of related form elements should be disabled

input.name: disabled
input.description: Specifies that an <input> element should be disabled

optgroup.name: disabled
optgroup.description: Specifies that an option-group should be disabled

option.name: disabled
option.description: Specifies that an option should be disabled

select.name: disabled
select.description: Specifies that a drop-down list should be disabled

textarea.name: disabled
textarea.description: Specifies that a text area should be disabled

a.name: download
a.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink

caveats: * Chrome 65+ and Firefox only support same-origin download links.

filename.description: Optional. Specifies the new filename for the downloaded file

area.name: download
area.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyperlink

caveats: * Chrome 65+ and Firefox only support same-origin download links.

filename.description: Optional. Specifies the new filename for the downloaded file

global.name: draggable
global.description: Specifies whether an element is draggable or not

boolean-auto.description:
auto: Uses the default behavior of the browser

true: Specifies that the element is draggable

false: Specifies that the element is not draggable

form.name: enctype
form.description: Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (only for method="post")

application/x-www-form-urlencoded.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
application/x-www-form-urlencoded.description: Default. All characters are encoded before sent (spaces are converted to "+" symbols, and special characters are converted to ASCII HEX values)

multipart/form-data.name: multipart/form-data
multipart/form-data.description: This value is necessary if the user will upload a file through the form

text/plain.name: text/plain
text/plain.description: Sends data without any encoding at all. Not recommended

label.name: for
label.description: Specifies the id of the form element the label should be bound to

id.description: The id of the element the label is bound to

output.name: for
output.description: Specifies the relationship between the result of the calculation, and the elements used in the calculation

id.description: Specifies a space separated list of ids of one or more elements that specifies the relationship between the result of the calculation, and the elements used in the calculation

button.name: form
button.description: Specifies which form the button belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <button> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

fieldset.name: form
fieldset.description: Specifies which form the fieldset belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <fieldset> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

input.name: form
input.description: Specifies the form the <input> element belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <input> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

label.name: form
label.description: Specifies which form the label belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <label> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

meter.name: form
meter.description: Specifies which form the <meter> element belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <meter> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

object.name: form
object.description: Specifies which form the object belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the <form> element the <object> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

output.name: form
output.description: Specifies which form the output element belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <output> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

select.name: form
select.description: Defines which form the drop-down list belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <select> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be equal to the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

textarea.name: form
textarea.description: Specifies which form the text area belongs to

form_id.name: form_id
form_id.description: Specifies the form element the <textarea> element belongs to. The value of this attribute must be the id attribute of a <form> element in the same document.

button.name: formaction
button.description: Specifies where to send the form-data when a form is submitted. Only for type="submit"

u-r-l.description: Specifies where to send the form data. Possible values: An absolute URL - the full address of a page (like href="http://www.example.com/formresult.asp") A relative URL - points to a file within the current site (like href="formresult.asp")

input.name: formaction
input.description: Specifies the URL of the file that will process the input control when the form is submitted (for type="submit" and type="image")

u-r-l.description: Specifies the URL of the file that will process the input control when the form is submitted. Possible values: An absolute URL - the full address of a page (like href="http://www.example.com/formresult.asp") A relative URL - points to a file within the current site (like href="formresult.asp")

button.name: formenctype
button.description: Specifies how form-data should be encoded before sending it to a server. Only for type="submit"

application/x-www-form-urlencoded.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
application/x-www-form-urlencoded.description: Default. All characters will be encoded before sent

multipart/form-data.name: multipart/form-data
multipart/form-data.description: This value is necessary if the user will upload a file through the form

text/plain.name: text/plain
text/plain.description: Sends data without any encoding at all. Not recommended

input.name: formenctype
input.description: Specifies how the form-data should be encoded when submitting it to the server (for type="submit" and type="image")

application/x-www-form-urlencoded.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
application/x-www-form-urlencoded.description: Default. All characters are encoded before sent (spaces are converted to "+" symbols, and special characters are converted to ASCII HEX values)

multipart/form-data.name: multipart/form-data
multipart/form-data.description: This value is necessary if the user will upload a file through the form

text/plain.name: text/plain
text/plain.description: Sends data without any encoding at all. Not recommended

button.name: formmethod
button.description: Specifies how to send the form-data (which HTTP method to use). Only for type="submit"

get.name: get
get.description: Appends the form-data to the URL: URL?name=value&name=value

post.name: post
post.description: Sends the form-data as an HTTP post transaction

input.name: formmethod
input.description: Defines the HTTP method for sending data to the action URL (for type="submit" and type="image")

get.name: get
get.description: Default. Appends the form-data to the URL in name/value pairs: URL?name=value&name=value

post.name: post
post.description: Sends the form-data as an HTTP post transaction

button.name: formnovalidate
button.description: Specifies that the form-data should not be validated on submission. Only for type="submit"

input.name: formnovalidate
input.description: Defines that form elements should not be validated when submitted

button.name: formtarget
button.description: Specifies where to display the response after submitting the form. Only for type="submit"

_blank.name: _blank
_blank.description: Loads the response in a new window/tab

_self.name: _self
_self.description: Loads the response in the same frame (this is default)

_parent.name: _parent
_parent.description: Loads the response in the parent frame

_top.name: _top
_top.description: Loads the response in the full body of the window

framename.name: framename
framename.description: Loads the response in a named iframe

input.name: formtarget
input.description: Specifies where to display the response that is received after submitting the form (for type="submit" and type="image")

_blank.name: _blank
_blank.description: The response is displayed in a new window or tab

_self.name: _self
_self.description: The response is displayed in the same frame (this is default)

_parent.name: _parent
_parent.description: The response is displayed in the parent frame

_top.name: _top
_top.description: The response is displayed in the full body of the window

framename.name: framename
framename.description: The response is displayed in a named iframe

td.name: headers
td.description: Specifies one or more header cells a cell is related to

id.description: Specifies a space-separated list of id's to one or more header cells the table cell is related to

th.name: headers
th.description: Specifies one or more header cells a cell is related to

id.description: Specifies a space-separated list of id's to one or more header cells the header cell is related to

canvas.name: height
canvas.description: Specifies the height of the canvas. Default value is 150

pixels.description: Specifies the height of the canvas, in pixels (e.g."100"). Default value is 150

embed.name: height
embed.description: Specifies the height of the embedded content

pixels.description: The height of the embedded content, in pixels (i.e.height="100")

iframe.name: height
iframe.description: Specifies the height of an <iframe>. Default height is 150 pixels

pixels.description: The height of the inline frame in pixels (e.g.height="100")

img.name: height
img.description: Specifies the height of an image

input.name: height
input.description: Specifies the height of an <input> element (only for type="image")

object.name: height
object.description: Specifies the height of the object

pixels.description: The height of the object, in pixels (i.e.height="100")

video.name: height
video.description: Sets the height of the video player

pixels.description: The height of the video, in pixels (i.e.height="100")

global.name: hidden
global.description: Specifies that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant

meter.name: high
meter.description: Specifies the range that is considered to be a high value

number.description: Specifies a floating point number that is considered to be a high value

a.name: href
a.description: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to

u-r-l.description: The URL of the link. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like href="http://www.example.com/default.htm") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like href="default.htm") Link to an element with a specified id within the page (like href="#section2") Other protocols (like https://, ftp://, mailto:, file:, etc..) A script (like href="javascript:alert('Hello');")

area.name: href
area.description: Specifies the hyperlink target for the area

u-r-l.description: Specifies the hyperlink target for the area. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like href="http://www.example.com/sun.htm") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like href="sun.htm") Link to an element with a specified id within the page (like href="#top") Other protocols (like https://, ftp://, mailto:, file:, etc..) A script (like href="javascript:alert('Hello');")

base.name: href
base.description: Specifies the base URL for all relative URLs in the page

u-r-l.description: An absolute URL that acts as the base URL (like "http://www.example.com/")

link.name: href
link.description: Specifies the location of the linked document

u-r-l.description: The URL of the linked resource/document. Possible values: An absolute URL - points to another web site (like href="http://www.example.com/theme.css") A relative URL - points to a file within a web site (like href="/themes/theme.css")

a.name: hreflang
a.description: Specifies the language of the linked document

language-code.description: A two-letter language code that specifies the language of the linked document. To view all available language codes, go to our Language code reference.

area.name: hreflang
area.description: Specifies the language of the target URL

language-code.description: A two-letter language code that specifies the language of the linked document. To view all available language codes, go to our Language code reference.

link.name: hreflang
link.description: Specifies the language of the text in the linked document

caveats: Note: The hreflang attribute does not render as anything special in any of the major browsers. However, it can be used by search engines, or in scripts.

language-code.description: A two-letter language code that specifies the language of the linked document. To view all available language codes, go to our Language code reference.

meta.name: http-equiv
meta.description: Provides an HTTP header for the information/value of the content attribute

content-security-policy.name: content-security-policy
content-security-policy.description: Specifies a content policy for the document. Example: <meta http-equiv="content-security-policy" content="default-src 'self'">

content-type.name: content-type
content-type.description: Specifies the character encoding for the document. Example: <meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">

default-style.name: default-style
default-style.description: Specified the preferred style sheet to use. Example: <meta http-equiv="default-style" content="the document's preferred stylesheet"> Note: The value of the content attribute above must match the value of the title attribute on a link element in the same document, or it must match the value of the title attribute on a style element in the same document.

refresh.name: refresh
refresh.description: Defines a time interval for the document to refresh itself. Example: <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="300"> Note: The value "refresh" should be used carefully, as it takes the control of a page away from the user. Using "refresh" will cause a failure in W3C's Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.

global.name: id
global.description: Specifies a unique id for an element

id.description: Specifies a unique id for the element. Naming rules: Must contain at least one character Must not contain any space characters

script.name: integrity
script.description: Allows a browser to check the fetched script to ensure that the code is never loaded if the source has been manipulated

filehash.name: filehash
filehash.description: The file hashing value of the external script file

img.name: ismap
img.description: Specifies an image as a server-side image map

track.name: kind
track.description: Specifies the kind of text track

captions.name: captions
captions.description: The track defines translation of dialogue and sound effects (suitable for deaf users)

chapters.name: chapters
chapters.description: The track defines chapter titles (suitable for navigating the media resource)

descriptions.name: descriptions
descriptions.description: The track defines a textual description of the video content (suitable for blind users)

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: The track defines content used by scripts. Not visible for the user

subtitles.name: subtitles
subtitles.description: The track defines subtitles, used to display subtitles in a video

optgroup.name: label
optgroup.description: Specifies a label for an option-group

text.description: Specifies a label/description for the option-group

option.name: label
option.description: Specifies a shorter label for an option

text.description: A shorter version for the option

track.name: label
track.description: Specifies the title of the text track

label.name: label
label.description: Specifies the title of the text track

global.name: lang
global.description: Specifies the language of the element's content

language-code.description: Specifies the language code for the element's content. Language code reference

input.name: list

generator.name: generator
generator.description: Specifies one of the software packages used to generate the document (not used on hand-authored pages). Example: <meta name="generator" content="FrontPage 4.0">

keywords.name: keywords
keywords.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of keywords - relevant to the page (Informs search engines what the page is about). Tip: Always specify keywords (needed by search engines to catalogize the page). Example: <meta name="keywords" content="HTML, meta tag, tag reference">

viewport.name: viewport
viewport.description: Controls the viewport (the user's visible area of a web page). The viewport varies with the device, and will be smaller on a mobile phone than on a computer screen. You should include the following <meta> viewport element in all your web pages: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> A <meta> viewport element gives the browser instructions on how to control the page's dimensions and scaling. The width=device-width part sets the width of the page to follow the screen-width of the device (which will vary depending on the device). The initial-scale=1.0 part sets the initial zoom level when the page is first loaded by the browser. Here is an example of a web page without the viewport meta tag, and the same web page with the viewport meta tag: Tip: If you are browsing this page with a phone or a tablet, you can click on the two links below to see the difference. Without the viewport meta tag With the viewport meta tag You can read more about the viewport in our Responsive Web Design - The Viewport Tutorial.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: Sends the origin (scheme, host, and port) of the document

Only use prerender if you are absolutely sure that the webpage is required at some point in the user's journey
